description.raw:
Until now, GUI plugins could only be defined on the `gui.config` file. That was not convenient for plugins which needed to specify topics and services that rely on the world name. This PR adds support for plugins inside the SDF file's `<world><gui>` tag.

---

For now, Ignition GUI plugins are wrapped by an extra plugin tag, i.e.

~~~
    <gui fullscreen="0">
      <plugin name="notused" filename="notused">
        <plugin
          filename="Scene3D"
          title="3D View"
          name="3D View"
          show_title_bar="false"
          resizable="false"
          x="0"
          y="0"
          z="0"
          height="798"
          width="1000">
         ...
        </plugin>
      </plugin>
    </gui>
~~~

This was necessary because SDF would strip the extra arguments within `<plugin>` if it were top-level. I don't have a strong opinion now on what would be the most appropriate way of handling that, so I left it as a TODO for now.

---

I added an example world which has a custom name that is reflected on topics and services:

`ign-gazebo -v 4 -f ../examples/worlds/shapes.sdf`

![shapes.world.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2590050284-shapes.world.png)
